https://www.oracle.com/database/technologies/datawarehouse-bigdata/adb-faqs.html

*Can I move my on-premises Oracle Database to Oracle Autonomous Database using RMAN backup and restore?
No, RMAN restore into ADB is not supported. You need to use one of the supported migration methods outlined above.

A and B
Explanation
The default data and temporary tablespaces for the database are configured automatically. Adding, removing, or modifying tablespaces is not allowed.
Oracle Data Pump offers very fast bulk data and metadata movement between Oracle databases and Autonomous Database .
Data Pump Import lets you import data from Data Pump files residing on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage, Microsoft Azure, AWS S3, and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic. You can save your data to your Cloud Object Store and use Oracle Data Pump to load data to

A, B is the answer.
Data pump is not faster than RMAN in this context

A, B for sure.
RMAN is still faster, but not a valid option

questions.question_text: What are two advantages of using Data Pump to migrate your Oracle Databases to Autonomous Database? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Data Pump is platform independent - it can migrate Oracle Databases running on any platform.
choices.D: Data Pump creates the tablespaces used by your Autonomous Database.
choices.A: Data Pump can exclude migration of objects like indexes and materialized views that are not needed by Autonomous Database.
choices.C: Data Pump is faster to migrate database than using RMAN.

questions.question_text: What are three methods to load data into the Autonomous Database? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
I think ADE

A. Oracle GoldenGate
D. Oracle Data Pump
E. SQL*Loader
A, D and E are correct

Explanation:
ADW designed for parallel joins and aggregations
ATP designed for Mixed workloads
ADW optimized for data-warehouse, data lake and data mart
Data format for ATP row-wise and for ADW columnar

Selected Answer: D
I agree with D.

D. Data that is bulk loaded, by default, uses the row format in Autonomous Transaction Processing where Autonomous Data Warehouse data format is columnar.

Selected Answer: D
ATP uses row format, while ADW uses columnar

Selected Answer: D
ADW designed for parallel joins and aggregations
ATP designed for Mixed workloads
ADW optimized for data-warehouse, data lake and data mart
Data format for ATP row-wise and for ADW columnar

choices.B: Autonomous Data Warehouse workloads are optimized for mixed workloads.
choices.D: Data that is bulk loaded, by default, uses the row format in Autonomous Transaction Processing where Autonomous Data Warehouse data format is columnar.
choices.A: Autonomous Transaction Processing memory usage optimizes workloads for parallel joins and aggregations.
choices.C: Autonomous Transaction Processing workloads are optimized for data warehouse, data mart, and data lake.

questions.question_text: While Autonomous Transaction Processing and Autonomous Data Warehouse use the same Oracle database, which statement is true about the workloads?
When scaling OCPUs in Autonomous Database, which statement is true in regards to active transactions?

discussion.content:
Reference:
Auto-scaling does not stop any ongoing transaction in the database

https://blogs.oracle.com/datawarehousing/now-you-can-automatically-scale-your-autonomous-data-warehouse-with-a-single-click

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer: A

A is correct answer to pass test

But database performance degrade during scaling period (look at ADB monitoring graphs).
It may be considered as pausing of some ongoing transactions (IMHO)

Selected Answer: A
Auto-scaling does not stop any ongoing transaction in the database

Selected Answer: A
Transactions does not stop
How we can say there is auto scaling.

choices.C: Scaling cannot happen while there are active transactions in the database.
choices.D: Active transactions are terminated and rolled back.

choices.C: CPU billing is halted based on full-hour cycles of usage.
choices.A: User with DWROLE can still access the database.
choices.B: Tools are no longer able to connect to a stopped instance.
choices.D: In-flight transactions and queries are stopped.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are correct when the Autonomous Database is stopped? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: User with DWROLE is the odd one out
